LP-VI-B.overview: Traffic patterns are the foundation of safe airport operations. This lesson teaches the standard rectangular traffic pattern, including all legs, proper altitudes, airspeeds, and radio communications. Students learn to integrate climbs, turns, descents, and landings into a continuous flow while maintaining situational awareness and collision avoidance.
keyTeachingPoints: Standard traffic pattern: Rectangular, left turns (unless right pattern specified)
Pattern altitude typically 1000 AGL for light aircraft
Upwind leg: Departure climb, heading aligned with runway
Crosswind: 90° turn at 500-700 AGL when abeam departure end
Downwind: Level flight, pattern altitude, 1/2 to 1 mile from runway
Base: Turn 90° at 45° from landing threshold
Final: Aligned with runway centerline, descending to landing
Maintain pattern altitude ±100 feet, airspeed ±10 knots
Radio calls at each leg (if towered or CTAF)
Continuous traffic scan - especially on base and final
commonErrors: Not maintaining pattern altitude - too high or too low
Flying too close or too far from runway on downwind
Early or late turn to base - affects final approach
Forgetting radio calls at position reports
Poor wind correction - drifting toward or away from runway
Not adjusting pattern for wind conditions
Descending early on downwind instead of abeam numbers
Fixating on one task - forgetting to fly the airplane

diagrams.title: Standard Left Traffic Pattern
diagrams.description: Overhead view showing all pattern legs
diagrams.asciiArt:
DOWNWIND (1000 AGL, cruise)
        ←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←
         ↑              ↓
UPWIND   ↑              ↓ BASE
(climb)  ↑              ↓ (descending)
         ↑              ↓
         ↑              ↘
        RUNWAY          FINAL
                     (descending)
Turns: All 90° left turns

diagrams.title: Pattern Leg Details
diagrams.description: What to do on each leg
diagrams.asciiArt:
UPWIND: Climb, runway heading
  ↓
CROSSWIND (500-700' AGL): Turn 90°, continue climb
  ↓
DOWNWIND: Level pattern altitude, reduce to pattern speed
  Abeam numbers: Begin pre-landing checklist
  ↓
BASE: Turn when 45° from threshold, descend
  ↓
FINAL: Turn to align with runway, continue descent
  ↓
LANDING
